page.title: 04A46:TRUNK ROAD
page.content:
The A46 is the major road running through Painswick, linking the village with Cheltenham to the north, and with Stroud to the south. There has been a road running along the same route, through the village since 1429. It became an important routeway because it connected the spa towns of Bath and Cheltenham,and so brought visitors and trade to Painswick. Today the A46 runs from Bath, beyond Cheltenham to Evesham, Coventry, Lincoln, finishing near to Grimsby. We conducted a traffic census on the A46 for thirty minutes,to gain some idea of the volume and variety of traffic,passing along the road.
Our traffic census results are shown on the next page:
